project.teaser: A specific aim of EU’s Open Science policy is to require all publicly funded research data to be FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) and open by default, and it’s even a contractual requirement for Horizon Europe beneficiaries. Despite large efforts, FAIR...
project.objective:
A specific aim of EU’s Open Science policy is to require all publicly funded research data to be FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) and open by default, and it’s even a contractual requirement for Horizon Europe beneficiaries. Despite large efforts, FAIR in practice is difficult for programme beneficiaries. EU has over the past 10 years funded Zenodo, an open data repository built by CERN, to help beneficiaries comply with first open access, and then open data contractual requirements. This grant capitalizes on past investments made in Zenodo and helps EC programme beneficiaries comply with the new FAIR and open science requirements, by implementing an easy go-to solution in Zenodo for beneficiaries to make data FAIR in practice.
HORIZON-ZEN’s overarching aim is to provide the EC’s programme beneficiaries with enhanced depositing services for digital research objects that are FAIR-enabling and compliant with Horizon Europe requirements, and to establish best practices for how scientific repositories can support the implementation of FAIR data principles by leading by example. This will be achieved by enhancing Zenodo with FAIR-enabling capabilities that support programme beneficiaries during the depositing of research outputs and by leveraging Zenodo’s simple and seamless user experience.
project.title: EU research programme beneficiary depositing solution in Zenodo

article.title: Making it easier for EU research funding beneficiaries to implement FAIR practices

result.teaser: A specific aim of EU’s Open Science policy is to require all publicly funded research data to be FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) and open by default, and it’s even a contractual requirement for Horizon Europe beneficiaries. Despite large efforts, FAIR...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: FAIR-enabling deposit workflow design
result.description: Short report showcasing the requirements and mock-ups to support FAIR-enabling deposition workflows in Zenodo.

result.title: Feature: Deposit/curation workflow
result.description: Code enabling the usage of third-party tools for improved FAIR capabilities. It will be made publicly available in GitHub.

result.title: User feedback logbook
result.description: Report collecting all user feedback for all features. This document will be updated regularly to meet the needs of the project development process.

result.title: Content and curation policy for the Zenodo-communities
result.description: Document defining the scope of content and curation level, as well as compliance with HE contractual requirements. The document will include a conceptual design of Zenodo features for the policy.

result.title: Release and deployment strategy
result.description: Short report explaining the release and deployment strategy and how it aligns with the development process.

result.title: Branded EC Zenodo-community design
result.description: Short report illustrating the agreed branding for the EC Zenodo-community, as well as describing the validation method for enabling users.

result.title: Sustainability plan
result.description: Report describing sustainability scenarios for the EOR-community.

result.title: Project plan and monitoring framework
result.description: Short report explaining processes and procedures including scheduling, change management, and quality procedures for internal reporting as well as risk mitigation strategy and updates.

result.title: Feature: Community dashboards
result.description: Code implementing new community KPI dashboards feature. It will be made publicly available in GitHub.

result.title: Feature: Branded communities
result.description: Code implementing the new branding feature. It will be made publicly available in GitHub.

result.title: Feature: Subcommunities
result.description: Code implementing all subcommunities. It will be made publicly available in GitHub.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
